common.closeAllTabMain: Close All Tabs in Main Area
common.closeOtherTabMain: Close Other Tabs in Main Area
common.showNextTabInGroup: Switch to Next Tab in Group
common.showPreviousTabInGroup: Switch to Previous Tab in Group

core.highlightModifiedTabs: Controls whether a top border is drawn on modified (dirty) editor tabs or not.

keyboard.tryDetect: Try to detect the keyboard layout from browser information and pressed keys.

core.quitMessage: Any unsaved changes will not be saved.
core.quitTitle: Are you sure you want to quit?
core.sashDelay: Controls the hover feedback delay in milliseconds of the dragging area in between views/editors.
core.sashSize: Controls the feedback area size in pixels of the dragging area in between views/editors. Set it to a larger value if needed.
core.silentNotifications: Controls whether to suppress notification popups.

debug.addConfigurationPlaceholder: Select workspace root to add configuration to
debug.debugViewLocation: Controls the location of the debug view.
debug.toggleTracing: Enable/disable tracing communications with debug adapters

editor.diffEditor.maxFileSize: Maximum file size in MB for which to compute diffs. Use 0 for no limit.
editor.editor.accessibilityPageSize: Controls the number of lines in the editor that can be read out by a screen reader at once. When we detect a screen reader we automatically set the default to be 500. Warning: this has a performance implication for numbers larger than the default.
editor.editor.autoClosingDelete: Controls whether the editor should remove adjacent closing quotes or brackets when deleting.
editor.editor.autoClosingDelete1: Remove adjacent closing quotes or brackets only if they were automatically inserted.
editor.editor.bracketPairColorization.enabled: Controls whether bracket pair colorization is enabled or not. Use 'workbench.colorCustomizations' to override the bracket highlight colors.
editor.editor.codeLensFontSize: Controls the font size in pixels for CodeLens. When set to `0`, 90% of `#editor.fontSize#` is used.
editor.editor.find.autoFindInSelection0: Never turn on Find in Selection automatically (default).
editor.editor.find.autoFindInSelection1: Always turn on Find in Selection automatically.
editor.editor.find.seedSearchStringFromSelectio: Never seed search string from the editor selection.
Always seed search string from the editor selection, including word at cursor position.
Only seed search string from the editor selection.
editor.editor.foldingImportsByDefault: Controls whether the editor automatically collapses import ranges.
editor.editor.foldingMaximumRegions: The maximum number of foldable regions. Increasing this value may result in the editor becoming less responsive when the current source has a large number of foldable regions.
editor.editor.formatOnSaveMode.modificationsIfA: Will attempt to format modifications only (requires source control). If source control can't be used, then the whole file will be formatted.
editor.editor.guides.bracketPairs: Controls whether bracket pair guides are enabled or not.
editor.editor.guides.bracketPairs1: Enables bracket pair guides only for the active bracket pair.
editor.editor.guides.bracketPairsHorizontal: Controls whether horizontal bracket pair guides are enabled or not.
editor.editor.guides.bracketPairsHorizontal0: Enables horizontal guides as addition to vertical bracket pair guides.
editor.editor.guides.bracketPairsHorizontal1: Enables horizontal guides only for the active bracket pair.
editor.editor.guides.highlightActiveBracketPair: Controls whether the editor should highlight the active bracket pair.
editor.editor.hover.above: Prefer showing hovers above the line, if there's space.
editor.editor.inlayHints.enabled: Enables the inlay hints in the editor.
editor.editor.inlayHints.fontFamily: Controls font family of inlay hints in the editor. When set to empty, the `#editor.fontFamily#` is used.
editor.editor.inlayHints.fontSize: Controls font size of inlay hints in the editor. A default of 90% of `#editor.fontSize#` is used when the configured value is less than `5` or greater than the editor font size.
editor.editor.inlineSuggest.enabled: Controls whether to automatically show inline suggestions in the editor.
editor.editor.language.colorizedBracketPairs: Defines the bracket pairs that are colorized by their nesting level if bracket pair colorization is enabled.
editor.editor.lineHeight:
Controls the line height. 
 - Use 0 to automatically compute the line height from the font size.
 - Values between 0 and 8 will be used as a multiplier with the font size.
 - Values greater than or equal to 8 will be used as effective values.
editor.editor.renderLineHighlightOnlyWhenFocus: Controls if the editor should render the current line highlight only when the editor is focused.
editor.editor.scrollbar.horizontal: Controls the visibility of the horizontal scrollbar.
editor.editor.scrollbar.horizontal0: The horizontal scrollbar will be visible only when necessary.
editor.editor.scrollbar.horizontal1: The horizontal scrollbar will always be visible.
editor.editor.scrollbar.horizontal2: The horizontal scrollbar will always be hidden.
editor.editor.scrollbar.horizontalScrollbarSize: The height of the horizontal scrollbar.
editor.editor.scrollbar.scrollByPage: Controls whether clicks scroll by page or jump to click position.
editor.editor.scrollbar.vertical: Controls the visibility of the vertical scrollbar.
editor.editor.scrollbar.vertical0: The vertical scrollbar will be visible only when necessary.
editor.editor.scrollbar.vertical1: The vertical scrollbar will always be visible.
editor.editor.scrollbar.vertical2: The vertical scrollbar will always be hidden.
editor.editor.scrollbar.verticalScrollbarSize: The width of the vertical scrollbar.
editor.editor.stickyTabStops: Emulate selection behavior of tab characters when using spaces for indentation. Selection will stick to tab stops.
editor.editor.suggest.localityBonus: Controls whether sorting favors words that appear close to the cursor.
editor.editor.suggest.preview: Controls whether to preview the suggestion outcome in the editor.
editor.editor.unicodeHighlight.allowedCharacter: Defines allowed characters that are not being highlighted.
editor.editor.unicodeHighlight.allowedLocales: Unicode characters that are common in allowed locales are not being highlighted.
editor.editor.unicodeHighlight.ambiguousCharact: Controls whether characters are highlighted that can be confused with basic ASCII characters, except those that are common in the current user locale.
editor.editor.unicodeHighlight.includeComments: Controls whether characters in comments should also be subject to unicode highlighting.
editor.editor.unicodeHighlight.includeStrings: Controls whether characters in strings should also be subject to unicode highlighting.
editor.editor.unicodeHighlight.invisibleCharact: Controls whether characters that just reserve space or have no width at all are highlighted.
editor.editor.unicodeHighlight.nonBasicASCII: Controls whether all non-basic ASCII characters are highlighted. Only characters between U+0020 and U+007E, tab, line-feed and carriage-return are considered basic ASCII.
editor.editor.wordBasedSuggestionsMode: Controls from which documents word based completions are computed.
editor.files.autoSave: Controls [auto save](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/codebasics#_save-auto-save) of editors that have unsaved changes.
editor.files.autoSave.afterDelay: An editor with changes is automatically saved after the configured `#files.autoSaveDelay#`.
editor.files.autoSave.off: An editor with changes is never automatically saved.
editor.files.autoSave.onFocusChange: An editor with changes is automatically saved when the editor loses focus.
editor.files.autoSave.onWindowChange: An editor with changes is automatically saved when the window loses focus.
editor.formatOnSaveTimeout: Timeout in milliseconds after which the formatting that is run on file save is cancelled.
editor.persistClosedEditors: Controls whether to persist closed editor history for the workspace across window reloads.

fileResource.overWriteBody: Do you want to overwrite the changes made to '{0}' on the file system?

fileResource.binaryFileQuery: Opening it might take some time and might make the IDE unresponsive. Do you want to open '{0}' anyway?
fileResource.binaryTitle: The file is either binary or uses an unsupported text encoding.
fileResource.overwriteTitle: The file '{0}' has been changed on the file system.

filesystem.filesExclude: Configure glob patterns for excluding files and folders. For example, the file Explorer decides which files and folders to show or hide based on this setting.
filesystem.maxConcurrentUploads: Maximum number of concurrent files to upload when uploading multiple files. 0 means all files will be uploaded concurrently.
filesystem.maxFileSizeMB: Controls the max file size in MB which is possible to open.

git.amendReuseMessag: To reuse the last commit message, press 'Enter' or 'Escape' to cancel.
git.amendRewrite: Rewrite previous commit message. Press 'Enter' to confirm or 'Escape' to cancel.
git.checkoutCreateLocalBranchWithName: Create a new local branch with name: {0}. Press 'Enter' to confirm or 'Escape' to cancel.
git.checkoutSelectRef: Select a ref to checkout or create a new local branch:
git.cloneQuickInputLabel: Please provide a Git repository location. Press 'Enter' to confirm or 'Escape' to cancel.
git.cloneRepository: Clone the Git repository: {0}. Press 'Enter' to confirm or 'Escape' to cancel.
git.compareWithBranchOrTag: Pick a branch or tag to compare with the currently active {0} branch:
git.dirtyDiffLinesLimit: Do not show dirty diff decorations, if editor's line count exceeds this limit.
git.editorDecorationsEnabled: Show git decorations in the editor.
git.fetchPickRemote: Pick a remote to fetch from:
git.gitDecorationsColors: Use color decoration in the navigator.
git.mergeQuickPickPlaceholder: Pick a branch to merge into the currently active {0} branch:
git.missingUserInfo: Make sure you configure your 'user.name' and 'user.email' in git.
git.stashChanges: Stash changes. Press 'Enter' to confirm or 'Escape' to cancel.
git.stashChangesWithMessage: Stash changes with message: {0}. Press 'Enter' to confirm or 'Escape' to cancel.

markers.tabbarDecorationsEnabled: Show problem decorators (diagnostic markers) in the tab bars.

messages.notificationTimeout: Informative notifications will be hidden after this timeout.

output.maxChannelHistory: The maximum number of entries in an output channel.

plugin-dev.debugMode: Using inspect or inspect-brk for Node.js debug
plugin-dev.failed: Failed to run hosted plugin instance: {0}
plugin-dev.launchOutFiles: Array of glob patterns for locating generated JavaScript files (`${pluginPath}` will be replaced by plugin actual path).
plugin-dev.noValidPlugin: Specified folder does not contain valid plugin.
plugin-dev.preventedNewTab: Your browser prevented opening of a new tab
plugin-dev.watchMode: Run watcher on plugin under development

plugin-ext.signInAgain: The extension '{0}' wants you to sign in again using {1}.
plugin-ext.webviewWarnIfUnsecure: Warns users that webviews are currently deployed unsecurely.

preview.openByDefault: Open the preview instead of the editor by default.

search-in-workspace.noFolderSpecified: You have not opened or specified a folder. Only open files are currently searched.
search-in-workspace.resultSubset: This is only a subset of all results. Use a more specific search term to narrow down the result list.
search-in-workspace.searchOnEditorModification: Search the active editor when modified.

terminal.confirmClose: Controls whether to confirm when the window closes if there are active terminal sessions.
terminal.confirmCloseAlways: Always confirm if there are terminals.
terminal.confirmCloseChildren: Confirm if there are any terminals that have child processes.
terminal.enableCopy: Enable ctrl-c (cmd-c on macOS) to copy selected text
terminal.enablePaste: Enable ctrl-v (cmd-v on macOS) to paste from clipboard
terminal.shellArgsLinux: The command line arguments to use when on the Linux terminal.
terminal.shellArgsOsx: The command line arguments to use when on the macOS terminal.
terminal.shellArgsWindows: The command line arguments to use when on the Windows terminal.
terminal.shellLinux: The path of the shell that the terminal uses on Linux (default: '{0}'}).
terminal.shellOsx: The path of the shell that the terminal uses on macOS (default: '{0}'}).
terminal.shellWindows: The path of the shell that the terminal uses on Windows. (default: '{0}').
terminal.terminateActive: Do you want to terminate the active terminal session?
terminal.terminateActiveMultiple: Do you want to terminate the {0} active terminal sessions?

toolbar.addCommandPlaceholder: Find a command to add to the toolbar
toolbar.failedUpdate: Failed to update the value of '{0}' in '{1}'.
toolbar.toolbarLocationPlaceholder: Where would you like the command added?

vsx-registry.recommendedExtensions: A list of the names of extensions recommended for use in this workspace.
vsx-registry.showRecommendedExtensions: Controls whether notifications are shown for extension recommendations.

webview.messageWarning: The {0} endpoint's host pattern has been changed to `{1}`; changing the pattern can lead to security vulnerabilities.             See `{2}` for more information.

workspace.closeWorkspace: Do you really want to close the workspace?
workspace.confirmDeletePermanently.description: Failed to delete "{0}" using the Trash. Do you want to permanently delete instead?
workspace.confirmDeletePermanently.solution: You can disable the use of Trash in the preferences.
workspace.confirmDeletePermanently.title: Error deleting file
workspace.failApply: Could not apply changes to new file
workspace.failSaveAs: Cannot run "{0}" for the current widget.
workspace.noErasure: Note: Nothing will be erased from disk
workspace.openRecentPlaceholder: Type the name of the workspace you want to open
workspace.preserveWindow: Enable opening workspaces in current window.
workspace.removeFolder: Are you sure you want to remove the following folder from the workspace?
workspace.removeFolders: Are you sure you want to remove the following folders from the workspace?
workspace.supportMultiRootWorkspace: Controls whether multi-root workspace support is enabled.
workspace.trustEmptyWindow: Controls whether or not the empty workspace is trusted by default.
workspace.trustEnabled: Controls whether or not workspace trust is enabled. If disabled, all workspaces are trusted.
workspace.trustPrompt: Controls when the startup prompt to trust a workspace is shown.
workspace.trustRequest: An extension requests workspace trust but the corresponding API is not yet fully supported. Do you want to trust this workspace?
workspace.untitled-cleanup: There appear to be many untitled workspace files. Please check {0} and remove any unused files.
workspace.workspaceFolderAdded: A workspace with multiple roots was created. Do you want to save your workspace configuration as a file?
